Job Title: Accountant | Hybrid

Location: Chesterfield, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job Description

MiTek is a platform innovator and enabler that exists to transform the building industry with better building solutions. In 1955, MiTek transformed residential construction with the invention of the Gang-Nail plate and a digital platform that provided an affordable and scalable way to manufacture wood trusses. Today, MiTek delivers software, services, engineered products, and automated solutions that enable the building industry to improve efficiencies by optimizing the balance between off-site and on-site. With nearly 5,600 team members worldwide, MiTek collaborates across the building industry to enable and accelerate transformational breakthroughs in design and construction to transform the way the industry designs, makes, and builds. As a Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK-A, NYSE: BRK-B) company since 2001, MiTek has a record of continuous growth and innovation. Learn more at www.mii.com.

Summary

Join our dynamic team as an Accountant and play a key role in driving excellence in our full-cycle accounting processes! You'll be responsible for supporting the full-cycle accounting function in a given month in various areas such as Accrued Liabilities, Prepaids, Fixed Assets, Software, Payroll related entries, and month-end account reconciliations. You will extend your support in preparing periodic financial statements and financial reporting to MiTek's holding company.

We're on the lookout for someone with more than just number-crunching skills - we want your passion for precision to make a real impact. Your mastery of Excel is a must, and if you bring experience with financial software applications like SAP, Oracle, Hyperion, OneStream or others, that's a definite bonus!

If you're ready to elevate your career and be a crucial part of our dynamic finance team, apply now!

Job Responsibilities & Requirements

MiTek Perks:


Flexible Paid Time Off - take as much time off as you need!All Benefits begin on Day 1!Profit Sharing Plan and Annual Incentive Plan13 Paid Holidays401k Plan with Matching ContributionsPaid Parental LeaveA variety of Medical, Dental and Vision Plans to choose fromShort-Term Disability Coverage, Long-Term Disability Coverage and Life InsuranceTuition ReimbursementCareer advancement and training opportunities


What you'll do:


Assisting with business unit month-end and year-end close;Preparing monthly journal entries and related support schedules;Preparing month-end balance sheet account reconciliations;Assisting with preparation of business unit financial statements;Maintaining and updating accounting policies and procedures;Providing data for annual budget;Maintaining and reconciling fixed assets and software schedules in CCH;Analyzing general ledger accounts and resolving discrepancies.


Qualifications:


Bachelors Accounting required or related field or an equivalent combination of experience and education which clearly indicates the ability to perform the essential functions of the position may substitute on a year for year basisUp to 1 Year Entry level experience required. Previous experience in public accounting or manufacturing related accounting and reporting a plus.Able to use Microsoft Office ApplicationsCertified Public Accountant (CPA) - External Agency/Certifier Certified Public Accountant preferred


Soft Skills:

Communication skills, teamwork/collaboration, problem-solving, analytical, adaptability and flexibility, time management

Additional Requirements


10% Travel to domestic MiTek locations as needed.


MiTek is an E-Verify and Drug and Tobacco-Free Workplace. 

We are an equal opportunity employer; and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ethnicity, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or transgender status), age (40 and over), genetic information (including family medical history), veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

For accommodation to assist with completing this application, please contact Human Resources at +1 314-434-1200.

www.mii.com

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
